main event: On September 12, 1956, a ground-visual UFO sighting was reported in Rossville, Georgia. The object observed was described as cigar-shaped, comparable in size to two-thirds of a full moon, and traveled from S.S.W. to W. before disappearing in three to five minutes.
interesting points: The duration of the sighting was relatively short, lasting only three to five minutes.
The UFO was described as cigar-shaped, which is a less common shape for reported sightings.
The conclusion of the investigation suggested that the object was likely caused by a reflection or burning of material in the atmosphere, indicating a prosaic explanation.
The report stated that no further investigation was warranted, implying that the authorities did not consider the sighting to be of significant concern.
The sighting occurred in the evening, as the object disappeared in three to five minutes, suggesting it was observed at dusk or nightfall.
